enable.label: Enable eMarketing
enable.tooltip: Disabling will only prevent any crontab from running. You can still send out campaigns manually.

newsletter_multistore.label: Newsletter Multi-Store support
newsletter_multistore.tooltip: Fix the Magento newsletter multi store bug

use_temp_tables.label: Use Temporary Tables
use_temp_tables.comment: Testing complex filters can be faster with this option enabled. DB user requires temporary table privileges though.

can_create_indexes.label: Allow filters to create indexes
can_create_indexes.comment: Allow to create missing indexes on existing tables to increase performance.
can_create_indexes.tooltip: Some filters may not perform well if they miss an index on important columns. A filter can check for known issues and create those indexes. Those indexes are only created if the filters are used.

enable_ckeditor.label: Enable WYSIWYG Editor
enable_ckeditor.comment: Enable the CKEditor for WYSIWYG
enable_ckeditor.tooltip: Remember, the CKEditor can also be disabled by each campaign if you disable design mode. This is usefull if the editor keeps messing with your code.

enable_ace.label: Enable Syntax Highlighting
enable_ace.comment: Enable the ACE Editor for syntax highlighting

enable.label: Enable UTM Parameters
enable.comment: When enabled, the ?utm_* parameters will automatically be filled in.
enable.tooltip: campaign, content parameters will be automatically set by each campaign.

utm_source.label: UTM Source
utm_source.comment: What to use for the `utm_source` parameter

utm_medium.label: UTM Medium
utm_medium.comment: What to use for the `utm_medium` parameter

enable.label: Enable Domain Throttling
enable.comment: Will prevent sending to many emails to one domain in a short timeframe.

time_threshold.label: Time Threshold [T]
time_threshold.comment: The treshold time (in seconds), works together with send threshold.

send_threshold.label: Send Threshold [S]
send_threshold.comment: The number of emails that can be send to one domain within the threshold time before we rest the domain.

rest_time.label: Rest Time [R]
rest_time.comment: The number of seconds to wait before sending an email to this domain again after the send threshold exceeded.

domain_specific.label: Domain specific
domain_specific.comment: You can define custom settings for each domains (e.g. gmail.com, hotmail.com)

inject_timeoffset_js.label: Inject Timeoffset JS
inject_timeoffset_js.comment: Use JavaScript to retrieve the users time-offset (most accurate)
inject_timeoffset_js.tooltip: The extension will place mini js snippet at the bottom (before_body_end) which will set a cookie (Mage.Cookies)

use_geo_ip.label: Use GeoIP
use_geo_ip.comment: Use any of the GeoIP adapters bellow to retrieve the recipient location by IP (Country, Region)

geo_ip_adapters.label: GeoIP Adapters
geo_ip_adapters.comment: Depending on the number of emails, a paid solution may be requried (1000+ per day)

enable.label: Enable Autologin
enable.comment: Customers can get logged in if possible automatically when clicking on a link
enable.tooltip: This is a global setting which will overwrite the campaign based setting.

expire.label: Expire
expire.comment: The number of hours after the email was send till the autologin expires. (0 = never)

enable.label: Enable Inbox
enable.tooltip: Warning: All emails will be deleted once pulled from the specified account bellow!
enable.comment: You need to configure an email inbox to check for bounce messages.

enable_forward_email.label: Forward non-bonce messages
enable_forward_email.comment: Any message that was not parsed as bounce or auto reply will get forwarded.

forward_emails.label: Forward to emails:
forward_emails.comment: A comma separated list of all emails to forward non-bounce messages. This can also be set per campaign.

unsubscribe_hard_bounce.label: Unsubscribe Bounces
unsubscribe_hard_bounce.comment: Automatically unsubscribe any emails that bounce off. (hard bounce only)

max_download_size.label: Max Inbound Email Size
max_download_size.comment: The maximum size in megabytes to download from the inbox.
max_download_size.tooltip: If email exceeds this limit, the email will still be downloaded but the content will be discarded. The max size should not exceed any PHP memory limit.

css_inliner.label: Enable CSS Inliner
css_inliner.comment: CSS will be parsed and then inject directly in the HTML code. Some email clients (e.g. Google) don’t allow CSS in the header.

test_mode.label: Test Mode
test_mode.comment: Emails will not get send to the recipients, but instead send to the address defined bellow.

list_unsubscribe_address.label: List Unsubscribe (mailto:)
list_unsubscribe_address.comment: Http list unsubscribe is handled automatically, if you use the bounce/inbox, enter the reply-to email address to automatically handle mailto: unsubscribes.

ttl.label: Email TTL
ttl.comment: All incoming and outgoing emails are saved for the above time to allow access to the content. Most of the time the content can be deleted as it is not required, but a minimum of 20 days is recommended.

transporter.label: Email Transporter
transporter.comment: How would you like to sendout your emails

sendgrid_category.label: Category
sendgrid_category.comment: Categories should be used to group messages together by broad topic. (e.g. Magento)

sendgrid_category_tags.label: Tags as Category
sendgrid_category_tags.tooltip: Each campaign can have tags for organise purpose, you can add those as category

sendgrid_unique_args.label: Add unique arguments
sendgrid_unique_args.comment: Use unique arguments tag to id emails
sendgrid_unique_args.tooltip: campaign id, recipient id, variation id, campaign name will be added to the email

mandrill_password.label: API Key
mandrill_password.tooltip: Any valid API key, you can create them in Mandrill under Settings => SMTP & API Info

mandrill_subaccount.label: Subaccount
mandrill_subaccount.comment: Optional subaccount id, leave blank if not used.
mandrill_subaccount.tooltip: Please note, the subaccount must b created first in Mandrill in order for the emails to be sent.

mandrill_default_tags.label: Default Tags
mandrill_default_tags.comment: Tags should be used to group messages together by broad topic. (e.g. Magento)

mandrill_category_tags.label: Include Campaign Tags
mandrill_category_tags.tooltip: Each campaign can have tags for organise purpose, you can add those to Mandrill

mandrill_metatags.label: Add Metatags
mandrill_metatags.tooltip: campaign id, recipient id, variation id, campaign name will be added as metatag to the email

mandrill_api_key.label: API Key
mandrill_api_key.tooltip: Any valid API key, you can create them in Mandrill under Settings => SMTP & API Info

mandrill_api_subaccount.label: Subaccount
mandrill_api_subaccount.comment: Optional subaccount id, leave blank if not used.
mandrill_api_subaccount.tooltip: Please note, the subaccount must b created first in Mandrill in order for the emails to be sent.

mandrill_api_default_tags.label: Default Tags
mandrill_api_default_tags.comment: Tags should be used to group messages together by broad topic. (e.g. Magento)

mandrill_api_category_tags.label: Include Campaign Tags
mandrill_api_category_tags.tooltip: Each campaign can have tags for organise purpose, you can add those to Mandrill

mandrill_api_metatags.label: Add Metatags
mandrill_api_metatags.tooltip: campaign id, recipient id, variation id, campaign name will be added as metatag to the email
